adverbs.description: eruditely (comparative more eruditely, superlative most eruditely)

entries.meaning: In a learned or scholarly manner.
examples: Learning was in his blood, for his great-grandfather, Sir Robert Jermyn, Bt., had been an anthropologist of note, whilst his great-great-great-grandfather, Sir Wade Jermyn, was one of the earliest explorers of the Congo region, and had written eruditely of its tribes, animals, and supposed antiquities.
